title: Yorkshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: council leaders fail to agree over south yorkshire devolution deal .
huddersfield man jailed for partner 's murder .
drivers pull mum and child from car about to burst into flames near whitby .
new week-long strike at closure-threatened sheffield job centre .
death of student found outside leeds house 'not sus .
crown court objects to york shakespeare theatre plan .
olympic legacy park opens to the public in sheffield .

documents.title: that 's all from monday
text: that 's all from across yorkshire on monday 18 september 2017 .
want to find out what 's happening where you live on tuesday 19 september ?
just click here .

documents.title: our top five stories today
text: that 's all from us for today , we 'll be back tomorrow from 06:30 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for yorkshire .
updates on breaking news will continue throughout the night , but before we go , let 's look back at some of our top stories from today :
see you tomorrow .

documents.title: south yorkshire devolution deal not to go ahead 'because of brexit '
text: this afternoon south yorkshire 's £ 900m devolution deal appears dead in the water after two of the four councils involved voted against the proposal .
the leaders of barnsley and doncaster councils say the deal `` is no longer possible '' and that they want to pursue a yorkshire-wide deal .
in a statement from barnsley and doncaster councils they say that a number of `` significant developments '' have taken place since the original proposal - including brexit .
they say that `` these decisions affect the next 30 years .
`` there is no way back once a deal is signed '' and that a yorkshire wide deal would be `` economically and politically advantageous '' .

documents.title: listen : no south yorkshire devolution 'the right thing '
text: accused of betraying the region , barnsley council leader sir steve houghton says not supporting a deal for south yorkshire was `` the right thing to do '' .
earlier today the four south yorkshire councils met to fashion an agreement on devolved powers , but they remain split 50/50 on the issue .
barnsley and doncaster favour a yorkshire-wide deal , but sheffield and rotherham support one for south yorkshire .
sheffield city council leader julie dore said barnsley and doncaster were guilty of betrayal , but sir steve houghton thinks otherwise :
author: Kevin Larkin
Political reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: 'free dentists ' on bus in dewsbury
text: from today free dental care 's available in dewsbury and mirfield .
the charity dentaid is driving a bus kitted out as a mobile treatment centre about to six locations throughout the rest of the month and into october .
funded by a grant of more than £ 7,000 the project 's to help those who 're struggling to get onto a dental clinic 's books or who may be suffering from poor oral hygiene .

documents.title: mayor 'defending doncaster ' in devolution talks
text: the mayor of doncaster , ros jones , says putting the interests of the people of doncaster first is n't a sign of `` craziness '' .
the four south yorkshire councils are divided over the best way for devolution to work in the region .
sheffield and rotherham want south yorkshire to have its own mayor , but doncaster and barnsley favour a yorkshire-wide deal on devolved power .
a meeting today to sort out the issue failed , with the leader of sheffield city council , julie dore , saying those against a south yorkshire-wide deal were a disgrace .
here 's ros jones ' reaction :
`` so i 'm a disgrace am i ? ''
`` of course you are '' @ twitterid & # sheffield 's julie dore after the meeting during my interview w/ @ twitterid
£ 30 million funding , a chance to dictate the skills budget and a more control over investment - turning their backs on that is a disgrace
the one yorkshire deal will eclipse all of this .
let 's get what london 's got for our 5 million people ; not divide and rule .
ambition .
or take this now and join that if it ever happens
well done @ twitterid @ twitterid # teamdoncaster @ twitterid # doncasterisgreat # ilovedn # southyorkshire # scr # devolution # oneyorkshire
donny sticking up for donny ?
sheffield said 'up yours ! '
to the s yorks region by going it alone with @ twitterid what goes around , eh julie ?
then why did they suppport scr for 20 years !
author: Kevin Larkin
Political reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: motorist driving at 110mph 'because he was late for game '
text: running late to see a football match is never going to go down well :
this driver said he was running late for yesterday 's @ twitterid game .
not an acceptable excuse for these speeds .
reported to court .
north yorkshire to manchester ?
says it all , some man utd fan eh ?
wayne rooney ?
they should get the chance to experience taking the train to some future games

documents.title: protestors 'slow walk ' in front of fracking lorries
text: there have been further protests at the fracking site near kirby misperton in north yorkshire today .
campaigners `` slow-walked '' lorries attempting to make deliveries and police moved several protestors away from the front of the site but no-one was arrested .
third energy was given permission by the county council earlier this month to begin moving equipment onto the site .
it is due to be the first uk site to carry out the technique since a ban was lifted in 2012 , the bbc understands .

documents.title: asda store in leeds attacked by armed robbers in 'terrifying ' raid
text: a supermarket in leeds was attacked by armed robbers this morning who have got away with a `` substantial amount of cash '' .
the raid happened just before 06:15 when two men wearing balaclavas armed with crowbars broke in through a door while staff were preparing to open .
they threatened workers and left with a large amount of cash and then left with a third man who was acting as a lookout .
they ran along a ginnel towards the high farm pub and drove away in a white 4x4 .
this was a terrifying experience for the store staff but thankfully no-one was physically injured ''

documents.title: flu jab myth-busting effort
text: which of the following is correct ?
a : flu jabs give you wings .
b : flu jabs give you super-powers
c : flu jabs give you flu .
answer : none of the above .
so says nhs england as it urges people to get a flu jab .
here are some things they 'd like us to see :
let 's bust some myths myth : the flu jab gives you flu fact : not possible , the jab does n't contain any live viruses # flufighter
why do people fall ill with `` flu '' after having the `` flu jab '' then ?
there 's some info about the flu jab here
so it gives you side effects - that are a bit like having the flu and then you might still get flu cos it only protects against one strain ?
there are many myths about flu and the flu vaccine .
visit and see 10 of the most common and the truth behind them
thanks - i think honey and a good single malt and a good hot curry cure most things .
i have never had a flu jab - but thanks all the same !
a little something to share with your followers :
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: car used in armed leeds bank robbery is found
text: a car that was used in an armed robbery in leeds last week has been recovered by police - now they want to know who left it there .
the stolen grey audi sq5 , was used in the raid on lloyds bank in morley on wednesday , the thieves were masked when they held up the branch :
the car was found on old lane in beeston on saturday afternoon after someone called the police and reported it as sus
the vehicle was left behind some shops near to the junction with dewsbury road and forensic experts are examining the vehicle for evidence .
we are currently continuing our inquiries into the armed robbery and the recovery of the vehicle used is a significant development ''

documents.title: it 's ok for football managers to take sweets from strangers
text: especially if that manager is sheffield united 's chris wilder .
he was sent to the stands on saturday for crossing into his opposite number 's technical area .
it seems a little girl in the crowd took pity on him , and held out her bag of sweets to cheer him up .
the club has been showing its appreciation on social media .
thanks to this little girl who attempted to cheer up chris wilder at saturday 's game # forgedinsteel # twitterblades
brilliant and hats off to @ twitterid aswell for his gesture
some things some our club up so brilliantly , they need committing to ink .
if anyone knows the little girl , she can have this one on me
it 's going down well with the family anyway .
you did n't hang about with that one !
cheers dom .
no worries .
i loved the original photo , love the homage as well .
you should have including the laughing guy in the hi-vis jacket !
that 's my dad - the steward .
the little girls grandad haha xx
oh wow , even better .
proper family affair .
it 's a brilliant photo .
i heard wilder mention it in the post match interview , had a chuckle .
i 've just listened .
could n't hear anything haha x
he defo said it , he said it cheered him up a bit after been sent to stands lol
@ twitterid troll loving it .
# legend
luckily .
that 's her grandad .
anyone know if she 's any good up front until billy is back ?
i 'm her mum .
she 's good footy player haha
lovely moment !
need more than a sweet sunday lol
0-1 yanic
author: Jonathan Buchan
BBC Radio Sheffield Sport

documents.title: listen : 'escape from death ' car crash thank you
text: a grandmother has offered an emotional thank you to the men who saved her daughter and four-month-old grandson from a crash near whitby , moments before the car exploded .
sardia hall-frankland 's 22 year-old daughter savannah has severe leg injuries and needed a seven-hour operation yesterday after the crash on the a171 near whitby at the weekend .
her baby son was rescued from the car uninjured .
north yorkshire police has also paid tribute to the men who stopped to help families involved , a passenger in a second car is `` very poorly '' in hospital .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: who is this ? police want this man after attempted burglary
text: do you know this man ?
police want to speak to him after an attempt was made to break into a house in clayton , near bradford .
it happened on the avenue at about 21:00 on wednesday 6 september when a witness saw someone try the back door of the house .
he could n't get in and left , but the witness followed him and confronted him and he denied trying to get into the house .
cctv was then checked and it confirmed he had tried to break in .

documents.title: listen : goodbye don valley , hello olympic legacy park
text: once it was home to don valley stadium , where olympian jessica ennis-hill honed her skills to become a world-beater .
now it 's the site of the olympic legacy park .
it offers mixture of sports , research , academic and leisure activities .
the whole thing is n't complete yet , but part of it has been opened to the public today .
author: Jenny Eells

documents.title: mum 's 'terrifying ' attack on stepchild
text: mum 's 'terrifying ' attack on stepchild

documents.title: gin festival and grumbling spirits in harrogate
text: organisers of a gin festival in harrogate have apologised after more than 200 people walked out .
some have taken to social media to vent their frustration over long queues at the event on saturday night .
it was gin rocks ' first event at ripley castle and featured live music and a chance to taste a variety of gins .
organisers have apologised for the delays on the bar and say they 'll learn lessons ahead of their next event .
author: Allan Watkiss
BBC Radio York, News

documents.title: student 's garden death 'not sus
text: student 's garden death 'not sus

documents.title: travel update : skateboarder hurt in huddersfield bus accident
text: a skateboarder has been injured by a bus in huddersfield .
police say it happened just after 13:30 on upperhead row .
a man in his 20s has been injured and is being treated by ambulance staff at the scene :
# huddersfield x63/503/549 due accident outside the bus station will divert ring road towards market street avoiding bus station .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: trueman enjoys 'bonus ' tigers start
text: trueman enjoys 'bonus ' tigers start

documents.title: analysis : is south yorkshire devolution dead in the water ?
text: anyone fancy electing a mayor that will have no power whatsoever ?
no ?
what if i told you it 'll cost us more than £ 1m ?
still no ?
that 's where we are in south yorkshire at the moment , a £ 900m devolution deal appearing dead in the water after two of the four councils involved voted against the proposal .
today 's meeting between the county 's council leaders was a quick end to the lingering idea that sheffield , doncaster , barnsley and rotherham might actually agree with each other .
we 're left with no extra money or power , and quite possibly an elected mayor that will just be another suit in the room .
doncaster and barnsley say their decision to end a south yorkshire devolution deal and seek a wider yorkshire one is not a gamble .
but when the government says that it just wo n't happen , the odds look pretty stacked against them .
author: James Vincent
Political Editor, BBC Look North

documents.title: huddersfield man jailed for partner 's murder
text: a man has been jailed for life for the murder of his partner and wounding her daughter .
beverley robinson , 42 , and her daughter nateesha hudson , 25 , were found with serious stab wounds at greenlea court , huddersfield , in february .
mark minott ( 41 , of the same address , was convicted of murder and wounding with intent to cause grievous bodily harm on 7 september .
judge guy kearl qc told minott he must serve a minimum of 18 years in jail .

documents.title: tears not cheers at harrogate gin festival
text: organisers of a gin festival in harrogate at the weekend have apologised after more than 200 people walked out .
the event , at ripley castle ( was organised by gin rocks .
people took to social media to express their anger at understaffed bars and long queues , with some describing the event as `` a shambles '' .
its organisers have confirmed that 250 out of about 2,000 guests left early .
they 've apologised for the delays on the bar and say they 'll learn lessons ahead of their next event .

documents.title: olympic legacy park opens to the public
text: olympic legacy park opens to the public

documents.title: historic horse fair gets under way in west yorkshire
text: travellers and gypsies from across the country are gathering in west yorkshire for the latter lee horse fair .
it 's an historic event which dates back nearly 1,000 years and starts today in west ardsley .
once a thriving marketplace for buying and selling horses , the fair now acts as a wider celebration of traveller culture .
organisers say they 're planning on burying a time capsule to mark the event .

documents.title: listen : what next for south yorkshire after failure of devolution meeting ?
text: the divisions over devolution for south yorkshire remain as stark as ever today after the failure of a meeting this morning which had been meant to sort out a deal .
south yorkshire 's four authorities are divided down the middle over how things should go .
sheffield and rotherham councils want a power-sharing deal for south yorkshire , while barnsley and doncaster councils want to be part of a yorkshire-wide plan .
here 's my summary of where we are now :
author: Kevin Larkin
Political reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: as you like it ? crown court 's objection to york shakespeare theatre plan
text: a plan to build a temporary shakespearean theatre in york next summer is facing opposition from the ministry of justice .
a full-scale `` pop-up '' shakespearean theatre would be of `` enormous benefit '' to the area , according to city of york council .
but york crown court bosses are unhappy with the plan to build the 950-seat theatre on the castle car park , close to the crown court and the historic clifford 's tower .
the ministry of justice says it is `` highly concerned '' as `` it will interrupt the smooth running of the crown court '' .
if the planning application to build the theatre is approved it will run between may and september next year .
however , it would mean the loss of about 135 city centre car parking spaces .
city of york council estimates it could bring in about £ 7m to the city and says it would be reimbursed for the loss of parking revenue by nearly £ 200,000 .

documents.title: multiple world squash champ to quit after this season
text: sheffield 's nick matthew is the only englishman to have lifted a world squash title
in fact he 's done it three times and has also led his country to a world title .
today he 's announcing that this season will be his last as a player , having previously hinted so to the bbc .
the 37-year-old turned professional in 1998 and in recent years he 's been working to get more young people involved in the sport .
i 've been playing since the age of eight and have made so many friends around the world , thank you for your support .
hopefully i 'll see you around the world this year if you can come to watch me in my last season . ''
author: Gina Bolton
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: breakingdeath of leeds student 'not thought to be sus
text: the death of a 21-year-old student - whose body was found outside a house on a street in leeds - is not thought to be sus according to detectives .
harry loker 's body was found on friday morning in the garden of a house on royal park avenue in hyde park .
he was staying with a friend at the house and had been out in leeds city centre the night before and officers say he went back there in the early hours of friday morning .
he was found collapsed in the garden at about 09:20 and was pronounced dead at the scene .
a post mortem examination showed he had a number of injuries that could not be accounted for .
his death is being treated as unexplained .
we have been carrying out extensive enquiries and there are no obvious sus circumstances . ''

documents.title: saucy cake for sheffield couple
text: when a couple in sheffield asked a cake-maker to create something special for to celebrate the sheffield roots this is what they got .
a cake in the shape of a bottle of henderson 's relish , which is made in the city , and it being poured onto a crusty pie .
we 're wondering how it tastes , the cake that is .
chances are there 's none left .
author: Amy Nagy
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: teenagers in hospital after bradford crash
text: two teenagers are in a serious condition in hospital after the car they were in hit a gate post in bradford this morning .
it happened at about 02:00 on edderthorpe street when a bmw was going towards leeds road and hit the post .
the 18-year-old driver was left with serious injuries and is being treated in hospital , his passenger - a 19-year-old woman - was also seriously injured and is in hospital .
police say they 're looking for witnesses to the crash .

documents.title: time to pull together yorkshire-wide for devolution , says mp
text: labour 's dan jarvis has called for yorkshire 's politicians to work with central government on a yorkshire-wide power deal .
the barnsley central mp 's comments come after a bitter end this morning to a meeting of south yorkshire councils to agree on a devolution deal between them .
that has failed , with barnsley and doncaster wanting to join a deal for the whole of yorkshire instead .
decision not to proceed with scr deal means national & local govt ldrs should work together on # yorkshire devo deal @ twitterid @ twitterid
no dan , it means squabbling yorkshire cll `` leaders '' have again protected their unelected powers and wages and ctaxpayers get poorer
sajid- yorkshire folk have had enough of these unelected & overpaid cll leaders .
can you suspend them and force metro mayors through please ?
the mayor is probably going to go through anyway just without any power .
elections will cost £ 1 million and 100k salary .
i 'd rather not
gov will remove councils powers and give them to elected mayor anyway like in w midlands
i hope not .
ca n't think of anything worse .
it 's politics mate - council leaders very unpopular in yorks with high ctax rises for nothing - gov want to be popular
i 'm all in favour of replacing the council do n't get me wrong i just do n't think one mayor would do the trick .
neither do i - i see 3/4 metro councils in yorkshire with high profile elected mayors
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: another week-long job centre strike in sheffield
text: workers have walked out again at a strike-hit job centre in sheffield .
it 's in protest at plans to close the office on eastern avenue as part of a national shake-up .
the government says it 'll make the service more efficient .
the public and commercial services ( pcs ) union says the strike action has the support of the whole trade union movement .
now is the time for the government to rethink their plans and stop this closure . ''

documents.title: breakingno agreement over south yorkshire power-sharing deal
text: a meeting to finalise devolution plans for south yorkshire has come to a bitter end .
the leaders of south yorkshire 's four councils came together this morning to try to overcome their differences over the best route for devolution .
their divisions have been well-known for some time , with barnsley and doncaster 's council leaders favouring a yorkshire-wide deal .
but sheffield and rotherham 's council leaders want a deal for south yorkshire and its councils .
the failure leaves major question marks for the area and threatens to hit other plans for devolved power beyond south yorkshire .
author: Kevin Larkin
Political reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: search and rescue team called in to help fallen walker
text: a woman who had fallen in one of west yorkshire 's most remote places had to taken to safety by mountain rescue teams yesterday .
the 64-year-old was walking near thornton moor reservoir on sunday morning when she fell and dislocated her shoulder .
calder valley search and rescue team were called in and 22 people were dispatched to find the woman and give her pain relief .
they then used a stretcher to carry her 1.5 miles off the moor to a waiting ambulance where doctors put her shoulder back into place .

documents.title: scarborough attack leaves man with 'life-threatening ' injuries
text: a 53-year-old man 's been left with life-threatening injuries after being attacked in scarborough .
police say it happened in durham place ( at about 22:00 on friday night .
three men , aged 20 , 26 and 31 , all from the local area , have been charged in relation to the incident and are due to appear at scarborough magistrates ' court later this morning .
officers say they want to speak to a man who is known to have walked along durham place and into north marine road at about the time of the incident .
police say he is not suspected of any offences and could be a key witness .
the victim is currently being treated at scarborough hospital .

documents.title: sheffield boxer wants golovkin title fight
text: billy joe saunders still has his sights on a match with gennady golovkin after the sheffield boxer 's unanimous points defence of his wbo middleweight title against willie monroe junior ( in london .
in the eyes of many critics , and even fans of his opponent saul alvarez , golovkin seemed to have won his own clash in las vegas at the weekend ( below ) , but it ended in a controversial draw .
the prospect of a re-match remains strong , but golovkin may take other fights before that happens .
if so , saunders has placed himself in the ranks of those who could face the unbeaten khazak .
while that would be the biggest pay day of his life , another potential opponent for saunders is fellow brit amir khan .
meanwhile , another fighter from sheffield , kell brook , suffered serious injuries to his eye socket when golovkin beat him in five rounds last year .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: listen : sessay stumped - cricket club 's national village cup dreams dashed
text: it was a disappointing weekend for sessay cricket club and its players ' dream of lifting the national village cup at lord 's for a second year in a row .
hertfordshire side reed beat the north yorkshire club by seven wickets on sunday , and some of their fans did n't even see them bat as their train was more than two hours late .
club secretary keith houlston says the day could have been a bit better :

documents.title: watch : south yorkshire devolution meeting gets under way
text: as south yorkshire councillors meet to decide control of devolved power in the region today , here 's my summary of the battle ahead .
given the divided views among councils in south yorkshire , today is set to be a big day :
here 's my take on the # yorkshire # devolution situation this morning .
30 mins until the crunch meeting more @ twitterid
author: Kevin Larkin
Political reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: monday 's yorkshire weather forecast
text: it 's a dry and bright start across much of yorkshire , with a few patches of mist and fog along with a few showers possible across eastern parts mainly .
watch my full forecast here :
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: listen : west yorkshire mp targeted by abuse in 2017 election
text: a west yorkshire mp is among those who say they received death threats and abuse during this year 's general election campaign .
nearly all of the mps who responded to a bbc survey - 87 % , in fact - said they had faced some form of abuse , including verbal abuse , vandalism and intimidation , on the campaign trail .
just over half of the mps said they were not bothered by the abuse they received , although 9 % said they had been `` extremely upset '' and 39 % were `` fairly upset '' .
dewsbury labour mp paula sherriff says online abuse was a daily occurrence during the election campaign and it created a sense of fear about what would happen next .
here she remembers one time when she logged onto facebook and was shocked by what she saw about herself :

documents.title: olympic legacy park opens in sheffield
text: i 'm out at sheffield 's olympic legacy park - what 's said to be a world-class facility for sports , education , health and leisure - which is set to be officially opened a little later today .
it 's not fully-complete yet and it sits on the site of the former don valley stadium .
the nhs and sheffield hallam univesity are involved in the project , and there 'll be a strong emphasis on research .
author: Jenny Eells

documents.title: listen : parking charges and stag parties blamed for `` failing '' york trade
text: retail in york city centre is `` failing '' , according to a report by a group of high-profile shop owners .
stag and hen parties , 24-hour parking charges and online shopping are all to blame , york retail forum says .
the organisation 's now launched a plan its members hope will turn things around .
but hanush wolf , the owner of burgins perfume shop , which closed this year after 137 years of trading in york , says he thinks the damage has already been done :

documents.title: watch : undercover reporter confronts spam text message pair
text: two men who boasted about being the biggest distributors of nuisance text messages in the uk have been exposed as part of a three-year bbc investigation .

andrew horner-glister and barry sanders , who ran several businesses , including one called clarity leeds , told an undercover reporter from inside out west midlands they sent `` 60 million texts a month '' .
the pair said when they did it up until 2012 , it was legal .
but the information commissioner 's office , which regulates the industry , says it 's been illegal since 2003 :

documents.title: motorists praised after pulling mum and child from crashed car
text: the bravery of motorists after a serious crash on the coast at the weekend has been praised by north yorkshire police .
officers say people stopped to help save two lives , by pulling a mum and baby from a car moments before it burst into flames .
it happened at about 10:00 on saturday on the a171 at normanby , just south of whitby .
police say a vauxhaul vectra appears to have lost control , crossing into the path of oncoming vehicles .
it struck a golf , with a 22-year-old mum and infant inside , which came to rest on the verge before bursting into flames .
people who stopped and pulled them out are being praised for assisting in an `` extremely dangerous situation '' .
the mum and a passenger in the vectra are in hospital with serious injuries .
the baby boy is unhurt .
anyone who saw what happened is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: d-day for devolution in south yorkshire
text: council leaders from barnsley , doncaster , rotherham and sheffield are due to meet this morning to decide whether to go their own way with a south yorkshire devolution deal or join other councils in a yorkshire-wide deal .
a total of 17 councils across yorkshire have said they want to unite behind a single devolution deal .
last week , barnsley leader steve houghton and doncaster mayor ros jones expressed their commitment to a yorkshire-wide devolution deal .
on friday , a letter from local government minister sajid javid increased the pressure on the four south yorkshire councils to agree on a way forward .
despite a range of proposals , councils have so far failed to agree a pan-yorkshire deal .

documents.title: check your train journey this morning
text: rail services across yorkshire appear to be running pretty much on time so far this morning , though there are a few problems .
first , if you 're heading south , journeys between derby/nottingham and leicester are being delayed by up to 10 minutes .
and trains are currently unable to run between meadowhall and rotherham central because of over-running engineering works .
rail replacement transports will shuttle passengers between the two stations until the work is completed .
you can click on the links below to keep up-to-date with the live departure boards for :
and you can click here for the latest updates on delays .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: investigation after leeds student found dead with unexplained injuries
text: investigations are continuing this morning after a student was found dead with unexplained injuries outside a house in leeds at the weekend .
leeds beckett student harry loker , 21 , was found collapsed on royal park avenue in hyde park .
west yorkshire police said mr loker was socialising with friends in leeds on thursday evening and left for home in the early hours of friday .
officers were called at about 09:15 on friday to reports a man had been found collapsed .
det ch insp jaz khan said : `` a post-mortem examination revealed harry had a number of injuries which can not presently be accounted for .
his death is being treated as unexplained . ''
in a statement , mr loker 's family said he was a `` devoted son , brother and perfect grandson '' and his death had left them `` broken '' .

documents.title: yorkshire 's monday weather
text: a dry , bright start for most , but the odd shower may affect yorkshire 's coast first thing .
showers developing more widely by late morning and into the afternoon , though most will be light .
cloud and outbreaks of rain are likely to cross all parts through this evening .
becoming mainly dry overnight and turning chilly , perhaps with some patchy mist or fog .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live in yorkshire on monday 18 september 2017 .
we 'll be with you until 18:00 tonight with all the latest news , views , weather , travel and sport updates from across yorkshire .
i thought we 'd start the week with this glorious bbc weather watcher pic of canine fun on the north yorkshire coast :
and remember , if you have a great pic to share or want to get in touch with us about what 's happening where you are , just email us here .
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire
